benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods/{paymentMethodId}/setDefault - Set the default payment method

covered: PUT > Valid Request: Multiple success paths verify the default payment method is updated correctly (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05).
PUT > Non-Existing Resource: 404s for missing account/payment method and mismatched ownership are covered (TC08, TC09, TC10, TC21).
PUT > Concurrency Issues: Concurrent requests ensure only one default at end and system consistency (TC22).
Input Validation: Invalid UUID formats and partial UUIDs return 400 (TC06, TC07, TC23).
Headers: Required header presence and optional headers behavior, including audit logging (TC04, TC11).
Query Parameters: payAllUnpaidInvoices true/omitted, pluginProperty multi/empty, unexpected extra param tolerated (TC02, TC01, TC03, TC24, TC14).
Business Logic: Old default cleared when new default set (Regression) (TC20).
Operational Resilience: Service unavailable/timeout scenarios (503/504) covered (TC13, TC18).
Performance/Scalability: Large unpaid invoices and concurrency performance constraints (TC17, TC22).
gaps: PUT > Partial Update/reject extraneous body: No scenario sends an unexpected JSON payload to verify it is rejected or ignored appropriately (e.g., 400 or 415).
Query Parameter validation (type/values): No tests for invalid boolean value for payAllUnpaidInvoices (e.g., payAllUnpaidInvoices=yes) or non-string pluginProperty types leading to 400.
Idempotency of PUT: No test that repeating the same request keeps state unchanged and consistently returns success without duplicate side effects.
Error Handling depth: No scenario for generic 500 Internal Server Error (e.g., database failure) response behavior and messaging.
Security headers/limits: No explicit negative tests for oversized header values (e.g., extremely long X-Killbill-Comment/Reason) causing validation errors.
recommendations: Add a test that sends a JSON request body (even though none is expected) and assert the API rejects it or ignores it per spec (400 or 415), satisfying the PUT Partial Update/reject-extraneous-data guideline.
Add tests for invalid query parameter values: payAllUnpaidInvoices with non-boolean strings, pluginProperty with non-string types or malformed encoding, expecting 400.
Add an idempotency test: invoke the same PUT twice and verify the second call returns 204 and no additional side effects occur.
Include a server error simulation (e.g., forced DB/plugin failure) to validate 500 handling and error payload schema.
Add boundary tests for header sizes/validation (very long X-Killbill-Reason/Comment and CreatedBy), expecting proper limits and errors if exceeded.
